channel.title: Sharing Leads Anonymously
channel.description:
# Problem?
I feel like ever since the introduction of Little Birds, BD's win rate has taken a hit. I would imagine this is mainly due to the fact that, without the whisper meta, it's pretty difficult for investigatives to coordinate with other BD without outting themselves. I certainly don't like the idea of open claim meta becoming dominant.
# Solution?
It seems like the most straightforward solution is to provide BD with some mechanism to share information anonymously (their class may be displayed but not their number).
Currently, the Mystic can do this through telepathy and the prince can technically do it by asking their jailed player to relay info, but the mystic is not a required class and is capped at 1 per match and the prince method is pretty roundabout. Also both of these methods face the same big problem that king whisper meta had, they rely very heavily upon the skill of just one player.
The lightest touch solution would be to simply require a mystic in every game as it used to be. This way, each game would have a built-in mechanism for investigatives to share their important leads without outting themselves. Downside is that less experienced players may not fill the information sharing role very well.
Alternatively, a more radical solution that I could imagine is some sort of notice board that operates through a night ability allowing investigatives to anonymously post feedback results from one past night of their choosing. This solution would obviously have pretty far reaching implicaitons which I certainly have not thought through completely.
What do you think? Is anonymous information sharing between BD even a problem that needs solving? If it is, what do you think is the best solution?

but yeah. WKM by definition has at least 1 person who knows who’s posting what lead (The King). No, manually adding such a person doesn’t help as then you just get WKM plus

VladTheImpaler:

King whisper meta served the function of passing information from one BD to another anonymously, and it didn’t solve the game and was certainly useful.

and what did we do to THAT meta again?

item.title: Sharing Leads Anonymously
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
VladTheImpaler:

I would imagine that evils would try to pass their info as coming from a sheriff or an observer in order to get an innocent executed.

AKA spam. Since they have no reason to STOP doing that

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing Leads Anonymously
item.dc:creator: VladTheImpaler
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Even without getting into how just because you don’t have hard evidence doesn’t make it random you do realize that this is the opposite part of having easy gamesolves unless it is setup in such a way that it is useless

I don’t think it has to be either game-solving or useless. King whisper meta served the function of passing information from one BD to another anonymously, and it didn’t solve the game and was certainly useful.

NuclearBurrito:

Not really. Evils are always going to send spam while BD are sometimes posting leads.

Why would evils always send spam? I would imagine that evils would try to pass their info as coming from a sheriff or an observer in order to get an innocent executed.

Read full topic

which makes it trivial to confirm normally unconfirmable invest classes

item.title: Sharing Leads Anonymously
item.dc:creator: VladTheImpaler
item.description:
Moleland:

But then you hard confirm the lead

Not necessarily. It’s not binary between hard-confirming leads and evils spamming every night. You could design the ability such that there’s a 60% chance the message came from BD and a 40% chance that it came from evil.

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing Leads Anonymously
item.dc:creator: VladTheImpaler
item.description:
Moleland:

Evils would spam it every night and BD would have to yolo which leads where genuine, or make people out themselves for their lead to be followed

This could easily be limited by making it an uncommon evil ability; e.g. giving it only to marshall and a single use as a seeker while having it more common among BD. This would mean that you have reason to suspect a message more likely comes from a BD than an evil.

Read full topic

item.title: Sharing Leads Anonymously
item.dc:creator: VladTheImpaler
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Open claim != Mass claim

True, but without an anonymous communication mechanism, it leads to a meta where investigatives will stay quiet until they are sure they’ve found an evil. This shifts the game towards luck because it’s basically chance if that sure-thing lead comes N1 or N6.

With anonymous communication, it becomes worth it to share less than 100% leads, such as finding someone k/o or an obs seeing a suspicious visit. With more leads that are non-conclusive being shared, it opens the game up to less chance and more strategizing.

Read full topic
